Package com.simon.simontree.model

Class ModificationBinaryTree

java.lang.Object
com.simon.simontree.model.ModificationBinaryTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
public class ModificationBinaryTree extends Object implements ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
A thread-safe custom binary tree that stores ModificationGroup objects with customizable sorting logic. The tree supports multiple tree logic (name, priority, total cost), various traversal methods and level-based operations. Uses Breadth-first search for many operations. Capable of adding and removing ModificationGroup. Auto-increments nodeCounter, totalNumberOfElements, totalNumberOfLevels. Implements the interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface. This is the most important part of the library, and does most of the main calculations.

Key characteristics:

  • auto-incremented nodeCounter, totalNumberOfElements, totalNumberOfLevels
  • base cost and TypeOfModification based totalModificationCost
  • reference to parent ModificationGroup
  • most methods in this class are called in the ModificationBinaryTreeOperations public-facing control class
See Also:
  • ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
  • ModificationGroup
  • TypeOfModification

  • Constructor Details

    • ModificationBinaryTree

      public ModificationBinaryTree(TreeLogic treeLogic)
      Constructs a new ModificationBinaryTree instance with a root Node, resets number of elements counter and with treelogic enum Automatically calculates totalNumberOfLevels.
      Parameters:
      treeLogic - enum, which defines the sorting logic of the binary tree, 3 options to sort ModificationGroup objects (name, priority, total cost))

    • getAllModificationGroups

      public Queue<ModificationGroup> getAllModificationGroups()

    • getTreePath

      public String getTreePath(ModificationGroup modificationGroup)
      Returns the hierarchical path of a ModificationGroup in the tree structure. The path is constructed using group names separated by " / " (e.g., "Root / Europe / Hungary").
      Specified by:
      getTreePath in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
      Parameters:
      modificationGroup - The group to locate (non-null)
      Returns:
      The full path in the tree, or an empty string if not found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if modificationGroup is null

    • insert

      public void insert(ModificationGroup modificationGroup)
      Inserts a new element into the tree while maintaining thread safety. Current level must always be 0 for auto-incrementation to work. Auto-increments totalNumberOfElements. Establishes parent-child relationship.
      Specified by:
      insert in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
      Parameters:
      modificationGroup - The ModificationGroup to insert (cannot be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if modificationGroup is null

      Throws:

    • findParentDRYComponent

      public ModificationBinaryTree.Node findParentDRYComponent(ModificationBinaryTree.Node current, ModificationGroup modificationGroup)
      Finds the parent of the given ModificationGroup in the tree. Uses compareGroupsDRYComponent helper method. A component in-line with the DRY Don1t Repeat Yourself principle, it can not substitute findParent in the current setup.
      Parameters:
      modificationGroup - The ModificationGroup, of which the parent we are searching for
      Returns:
      The parents Node, or null if no parent exists

    • searchNodesForModificationGroup

      public ModificationBinaryTree.Node searchNodesForModificationGroup(ModificationGroup modificationGroup)
      Finds the node containing the specified modification group using BFS(Breadth-first Search). Public method, therefore nullPointerException can still occur here, despite the Objects.requireNonNull further up the chain.
      Specified by:
      searchNodesForModificationGroup in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
      Parameters:
      modificationGroup - The modification group to find (non-null)
      Returns:
      The Node in which the modificationGroup is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if modificationGroup is null
      NoSuchElementException - if modificationGroup is not found or tree is empty

    • searchNodesForModifications

      public ModificationBinaryTree.Node searchNodesForModifications(Modification modification)
      Finds the node containing the specified modification using BFS (Breadth-first Search). Public method, therefore nullPointerException can still occur here, despite the Objects.requireNonNull further up the chain.
      Specified by:
      searchNodesForModifications in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
      Parameters:
      modification - The modification to find
      Returns:
      The parent ModificationGroup of the modification the method searches for
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if modification is null
      NoSuchElementException - if tree is empty or modification not found

      Parameters:
      modificationGroup - The group to locate (can be null)
      Returns:

      public Set<Modification> getModificationsOfGivenModificationGroupAndItsChildren(ModificationGroup modificationGroup) throws NoSuchElementException
      Returns a Set of all Modification of the given ModificationGroup and its children. It uses BFS.
      Specified by:

      modificationGroup - The ModificationGroup, which will be investigated
      Returns:
      Set of all Modification of this ModificationGroup and its' children
      Throws:

    • findModificationOnGivenLevelById

      public Modification findModificationOnGivenLevelById(int id, int level) throws NoSuchElementException
      Finds a modification with the specified ID at the given tree level.
      Specified by:
      findModificationOnGivenLevelById in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the modification to find (must be positive)
      level - The tree level to search in (0-based)
      Returns:
      The found Modification
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no modification with the given ID exists at the specified level
      IllegalArgumentException - if level is invalid (negative or exceeds tree depth)
      NullPointerException - if the tree is empty

    • getListOfModificationGroupsOnGivenLevel

      public Set<ModificationGroup> getListOfModificationGroupsOnGivenLevel(ModificationGroup modificationGroup, int targetLevel)
      Retrieves all ModificationGroups at a given level of the binary tree. The method is public, therefore it check for NullPointerException and has ModificationGroup as an input value.
      Specified by:
      getListOfModificationGroupsOnGivenLevel in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
      Parameters:
      modificationGroup - The ModificationGroup which you want to check
      targetLevel - The target level to search for (0-based)
      Returns:
      Set found at the specified level, empty set if level doesn't exist

    • calculateTotalNumberOfLevels

      public int calculateTotalNumberOfLevels()
      Calculates the total number of levels in the tree. In the special case that only root node exists it return 0 correctly. Returns -1 in case of empty tree.
      Returns:
      The number of levels (0 for empty tree), returns -1 if the tree is empty

    • printTreeStructure

      public void printTreeStructure()

      Specified by:
      printTreeStructure in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface

      public void printTreeLevels()

    • inOrder

      public void inOrder()
      Performs an in-order traversal of the tree (left -> root -> right) and displays each element. This is the equivalent of sort() by natural ordering, which means from smallest to biggest.
      Specified by:
      inOrder in interface ModificationBinaryTreeInterface
